definition: icon/iconic/religious image/figure (of Confucius, Buddha, Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1]
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: They found an icon in the monastery .
sentences.chinese: 他們在修道院中發現了一個聖像。

sentences.english: This holy image of the Dragon King came down to me from Guru Chen.
sentences.chinese: 此龍王聖像乃陳上師留傳下來給我的。

sentences.english: This was the holy ikon that had been brought away from Smolensk, and had accompanied the army ever since.
sentences.chinese: 這是從斯摩棱斯克運出並且從此就跟着軍隊的聖像。

sentences.english: Before this ancient image penitent emperors now prostrate themselves in awe.
sentences.chinese: 悔悟的皇帝如今敬畏地拜倒在這尊古聖像面前。

sentences.english: Thanks to Jacek in Poland for sharing these rare holy images.
sentences.chinese: 感謝波蘭的亞瑟分享這些稀有的聖像。

sentences.english: Post all sketches for embroidery of holy images and related teachings on-line in a file under Miscellaneous category.
sentences.chinese: 將所有供刺繡用的素描聖像及相關文章以其他類上傳。

sentences.english: A tsar was a living icon, invested with deep historical and religious significance.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇曾是活着的聖像，具有深遠的歷史和宗教意義。

sentences.english: The iconoclasts had lost the century old debate.
sentences.chinese: 聖像破壞者輸掉了這場長達一世紀的爭執。

sentences.english: Icon painters’ premises. They work next door.
sentences.chinese: 聖像畫匠的辦公室，他們在隔壁工作。

sentences.english: Underneath the sum of those who centuries before had fought iconoclasm and found their way to paradise.
sentences.chinese: 幾世紀前力抗聖像破壞運動的衆人找到通往天堂之路。

sentences.english: Candles dedicated to various saints crowd his table, most with photographs lashed to them.
sentences.chinese: 他的桌子上擺滿了聖像和蠟燭，上面還綁了很多照片。

definition: Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Matsu, name of a sea goddess still widely worshipped on the SE China coast and in SE Asia
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
